NEWS BITES

U.S. Rents Fall for the First Time Since 2017 The average cost of rent across the U.S. fell slightly last month, by 0.1%. While the dip is minimal, it marks the first monthly decrease in rent prices since Feb. 2017. The fact that the year-over-year growth rate of 3.2% was the lowest seen in 13 months suggests that it might be a sign of things to come. A study of rent prices across the country suggested that apartment rents had fallen in 59% of small cities and 56% of large cities. World Property Journal

Chinese Passports Cause Difficulty for Investors in Vietnam Chinese buyers are finding it difficult to invest in Vietnamese homes. The fact that Chinese passports depict a map of the Paracel Islands, which are disputed territory, can be off-putting to the government officials who require that the owner’s passport be submitted in order for them to obtain a document needed to own property. Vietnamese apartments have become highly sought as Hong Kong’s high prices have prompted many to look elsewhere in Asia. South China Morning Post

Singaporeans Holding Off On Real Estate Purchases Many in Singapore are choosing to hold off on home purchases, according to a survey from PropertyGuru that asked respondents how likely they were to buy property in the next six months. The number of those looking to buy in that time period hit an all-time low. Around half of people reported that they felt the economy was not strong, while 80% said that they believed that home prices were too high. Business Times

Cindy Crawford and Rande Gerber Eye Manhattan Condo Cindy Crawford and husband Rande Gerber visited a full-floor unit at a new building from prize-winning architect Tadao Ando in downtown Manhattan. The four-bedroom, 4,158-square-foot home is listed for $13.75 million. Model Bella Hadid recently toured a neighboring unit in the building, which was priced at $5.98 million. New York Post
